results.title: John Davis
results.creator_credit: Robert Lindsay, Bob Weis, National Gallery of Victoria and Open Channel Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Survey (National Gallery of Victoria)”.
Shows the work of Victorian sculptor John Davis, who uses many unusual materials and concepts to create modern sculpture

results.title: Martin Sharp
results.creator_credit: Andrew Scollo, Ken Otton, Robert Lindsay, National Gallery of Victoria and Open Channel Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Survey (National Gallery of Victoria)”.
Part of a series which looks at individual artists and their works. Martin Sharp discusses his beginnings as a cartoonist for Oz magazine in the sixties and his many styles of painting. Sharp’s art has always reflected the concerns of his own personal world and in that sense is highly diaristic, recording images people and objects that have contributed to his perception of the world.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Andrew Scollo, Ken Otton, Robert Lindsay, National Gallery of Victoria and Open Channel Productions

results.title: Rosalie Gascoigne
results.creator_credit: Bob Weis, Judi Stack, Robert Lindsay, National Gallery of Victoria and Open Channel Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Survey (National Gallery of Victoria)”.
Rosalie Gascoigne talks about her work and interests. She is a self-taught assemblage artist who uses weathered, discarded junk from man-made objects and found objects from nature. Her assemblages create images of domestic country kitchens while her late installations have an outdoor open feeling for country air and light
results.creator_credit_for_label: Bob Weis, Judi Stack, Robert Lindsay, National Gallery of Victoria and Open Channel Productions

results.title: Survey 12: on paper
results.creator_credit: Andrew Scollo, Michael Bongiovanni, Ray Harris, Robert Lindsay and Open Channel Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Survey (National Gallery of Victoria)”.
Part of a series which looks at individual artists and their works. This program interviews four artists, Micky Allan, Mandy Martin, Sally Robinson and Jenny Watson. Each artist discusses their philosophies, influences, subject matter, background in art, methods, materials and work. Each has been influenced by or incorporates photography in their work.

results.title: Survey (National Gallery of Victoria)
results.creator_credit: Robert Lindsay, Bob Weis, National Gallery of Victoria and Open Channel Productions
results.brief_description: In 1980 a series of Survey exhibitions was presented at the National Gallery of Victoria. These videos were produced as an introduction to the work of the individual artists represented in the exhibitions.

results.title: Survivors of the Holocaust
results.creator_credit: Allan Holzman, James Moll, June Beallor and Turner Original Productions
results.brief_description: Chronicles the events of the Shoah (Holocaust) as witnessed by those who survived. This documentary combines archival footage with the survivor’s personal testamonies and photographs, describing life in pre-war Europe, the devastating impact of Nazism, the liberation of the concentration camps and life fifty years later. The impact of the survivor’s stories prompted Steven Spielberg to establish Survivors of the Shoah Visual History Foundation, a non-profit project to videotape tens of thousands of these personal accounts and make them available for education worldwide.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Allan Holzman, James Moll, June Beallor and Turner Original Productions

results.title: Survival of spaceship earth
results.creator_credit: Dirk Summers and United Productions of America
results.brief_description: Fosters an understanding of the effects technological development and human population have had on the earth’s ecology. Features Hugh Downs, Margaret Mead, John D. Rockefeller III, Lady Barbara Ward Jackson, Harrison Brown, and Walter Orr Roberts. Narrated by Raymond Burr.

results.title: Survival in the hills
results.creator_credit: Christopher Were, Maurice Dybeck, Peter Halket and Explorer Films
results.brief_description: Aimed at anyone who is responsible in any way for mountain safety, whether as a leader or merely for themselves. Covers topics including: things that can go wrong; all aspects relating to exposure; suitable food and drinks; how to get help map and compass work; detours; accidents and simple first aid; and a summary of helpful general rules

results.title: Sur les Bords du Saint-Laurent
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Le Tresor des Hollandais”.
Today is the day for Jacinthe and Bicou to present for their dance exam. Jacinthe gives her precious ring to Bicou’s father for tightening. He is quick to realise that the ring is not a prop but a high quality diamond.

Credits: Director, Philippe Agostini; writer, Odette Joyeux; photography, Christian Petard; music, Georges Auric; choreography, Michel Descombey; costumes, Pierre Balmain.
Cast: Claude Bessy, Claude Ariel, Catherine Bouchy, Pierre Didier, Felix Marten, Jacques Fabbri, Robert Manuel.

results.title: Les Anges de la Route
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Le Tresor des Hollandais”.
Olympe and the last members of the Corps de Ballet are finally on their way to the airport. On the roof of their car, they are carrying a huge accessories basket containing Coppelia and the treasure. Not far behind, Stephane and Lulu are making sure that the basket duly goes through customs. Stephane who was due to take his cabaret show to Las Vegas is informed by Morales that he must follow the ballet to Canada and supervise the return of the real jewels to the Canadian contact. Meanwhile, the injured nightwatchman is making interesting revelations to Inspector Boudot.

Credits: Director, Philippe Agostini; writer, Odette Joyeux; photography, Christian Petard; music, Georges Auric; choreography, Michel Descombey; costumes, Pierre Balmain.
Cast: Claude Bessy, Claude Ariel, Catherine Bouchy, Pierre Didier, Felix Marten, Jacques Fabbri, Robert Manuel.
